> Isn't the problem that you're getting an Error and not

N=
ot quite.  The way I understood this problem when it first got posted (some=
 time ago now) is that the tested method itself starts a new Thread.  This,=
 and this alone (the multithreaded nature of the problem), is the basis for=
 all the troubles.

Take a look at the ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(...) m=
ethod for a solution.  I.e. you would need to wrap the call within a Thread=
Group() which overrides this method so as to report errors or failures in t=
he appropriate manner.
